Description:
Scrach Programming is a good start in starting your journey in #ProgrammingTomorrow

Want to learn about programmin but don't know where to begin? Scratch allows scouts to learn the basic of programming: Logic Formulation.

This camp provides an introduction to computer science using Scratch, a programming language developed by MIT. The course will allow students to develop logic skills, in preparation for more advanced programming languages.

Course Outline:
        1 - Introduction to the Scratch Interface
        2 - Logic Formulation
        3 - Looping
        4 - Form Creation
        5 - Game Development

Learn how to develop more interactive games with Scratch.

Jr. Programming 2 is a continuation of the Scratch programming series. This camp allows scouts to explore advanced topics in Scratch programming, specifically user interfacing. By the end of the camp, scouts shall be able to develop an interactive game using Scratch.

Course Outline:
        1 - Review of Basic Concepts
        2 - Mouse Events
        3 - Basic Design and Animation
        4 - Debugging
        5 - Game Development

Learn one of the most powerful programming languages and you can even develop your own language some day.

C++ programming is a good start in the field of software development. It is one of the most popular programming languages for its processing speed and functionality. It is often used in the fields of software development, robotics, scientific computing, and is used to develop other programming languages.

Course Outline:
        1 - Hello World
        2 - Variables
        3 - Logic Formulation
        4 - Loops
        5 - Program Development

Expand your skills in C++ and learn more about advanced concepts with this camp.

This camp allows scouts to upgrade their skills and make their programs more modular. By the end of this camp,  is a good start in the field of software development. It is one of the most popular programming languages for its processing speed and functionality. It is often used in the fields of software development, robotics, scientific computing, and is used to develop other programming languages.

Course Outline:
        1 - Review of Basic Concepts
        2 - Arrays
        3 - Functions
        4 - File Streaming
        5 - Program Development

Create your first graphical program with C#.


C# is a good start for scouts who want to explore the fields of app and game development. It allows scouts to create programs that have graphical user interfaces with buttons, text boxes, and even images. By the end of this camp, scouts will be able to make their first game with C#.

Course Outline:
        1 - Basic C# Concepts
        2 - Object Components
        3 - Event Handling
        4 - Graphics and Animations
        5 - Program Development

Create your first mobile application with Java on Android Studio.

This camp allows scouts to develop mobile applications with a graphical user interface on an Android device. The camp uses Android Studio for application development and covers concepts from basic Java programming to application building.

Course Outline:
        1 - Android Studio Environment
        2 - Basic Java Concepts
        3 - Object Components
        4 - Event Handling
        5 - Graphics and Animations

Create your very own retro game with Unity, an industry-level game engine.

This camp allows scouts to develop their own retro game using Unity. The camp uses Unity, an industry-level game engine for developing both 2D and 3D projects. Game Development 1 focuses on 2D game development.

Course Outline:
        1 - Unity Environment
        2 - Basic C# Programming
        3 - Pre-fabs
        4 - Animation
        5 - Game Development

Create your very own 3D game with Unity, an industry-level game engine.

This camp allows scouts to develop their own airplane simulator game using Unity. The camp uses Unity, an industry-level game engine for developing both 2D and 3D projects. Game Development 2 focuses on 3D game development.

Course Outline:
        1 - Unity 3D Environment
        2 - Movement Scripting
        3 - Camera Movement
        4 - 3D Movement and Animation
        5 - Game Development

Start your journey in becoming a data scientist with Python.

Python is a high-level object-oriented programming language. It is designed to be easy to understand, as it uses simple English words. It is used in game development, web development, machine learning, AI, and scientific computing. The Data Science 1 camp focuses on the basic concepts to develop your first calculator.

Course Outline:
        1 - Python Environment
        2 - Lists, Dictionaries, and Logic Formulation
        3 - Looping
        4 - Modules and Functions
        5 - File Handling

Learn more about advanced concepts about data structure algorithms in Python.

Python is a high-level object-oriented programming language. It is designed to be easy to understand, as it uses simple English words. It is used in game development, web development, machine learning, AI, and scientific computing. The Data Science 2 camp focuses on algorithm development.

Course Outline:
        1 - Introduction to Algorithms
        2 - Pointers
        3 - Stacks / Queues
        4 - Linked Lists
        5 - Searching and Sorting Algorithms
